name: Baitulmaal, Inc.
mission: Baitulmaal provides life-saving, life-sustaining, and life-enriching humanitarian aid to under-served populations around the world regardless of faith or nationality. Baitulmaal serves as a conduit between the compassion of our donors and the needs of their beneficiaries. We turn compassion into hope for those in need.
theoryOfChange: Baitulmaal acts as a conduit between donor compassion and beneficiary needs through a three-pillar approach: Respond (emergency), Sustain (basic needs), and Thrive (education/economic development).

evaluationSources: Gates Foundation (supported maternity unit in Somalia)

zakatClaimEvidence: Organization name implies zakat acceptance ('baitulmaal') (Source: https://www.baitulmaal.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 41/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Baitulmaal, Inc. shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization name implies zakat acceptance ('baitulmaal') (Source: https://www.baitulmaal.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: Baitulmaal holds a Charity Navigator score of 99.0/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 93.6%.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides options for donors to contribute to specific asnaf categories.
Total revenue for the period was $23,687,125 with fundraising efficiency at $0.10 per $1 raised.
Baitulmaal focuses on disaster relief, sustainable development, and orphan sponsorship to help people lead productive lives.
The charity offers multiple giving methods and holds 10.0 months of working capital for organizational stability.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Baitulmaal earns a solid GMG score of 73/100 due to its high financial accountability and strong alignment with humanitarian causes, though its impact score reflects a need for more direct evidence of cost-effectiveness.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing direct impact measurement to improve the current impact score of 32/50
Increasing third-party evidence of long-term program outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high at 41/50, reflecting a strong fit for donors seeking humanitarian causes and zakat-eligible giving options [2]. The charity's mission to empower orphans and provide disaster relief aligns with urgent global needs and traditional Islamic giving values [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates moderate impact with a score of 32/50, characterized by direct service delivery and a cost per beneficiary of approximately $974.07 [1]. While it maintains a high program expense ratio of 93.6%, there is room to further validate the long-term effectiveness of its sustainable development programs [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Baitulmaal, Inc. provides high-impact humanitarian aid and sustainable development to vulnerable populations globally while maintaining exceptional financial transparency.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 93.6% ensuring most funds reach beneficiaries
Strong financial health with 10.0 months of working capital
Excellent fundraising efficiency at $0.10 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Baitulmaal, Inc. is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing disaster relief, orphan sponsorship, and sustainable development tools to help individuals lead productive lives [4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various asnaf categories [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Baitulmaal earns a solid GMG score of 73/100 due to its high financial accountability and strong alignment with humanitarian causes, though its impact score reflects a need for more direct evidence of cost-effectiveness.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization has experienced a <cite id="3">-15.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>, indicating a recent contraction in funding.
The organization operates with a relatively small board of <cite id="3">4 members</cite>, which could be expanded for broader oversight.

case_against.mitigation_notes: Despite revenue fluctuations, the organization maintains excellent financial health and working capital reserves.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns relate to recent revenue contraction and governance scale. The organization has a <cite id="3">-15.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite> and operates with a small board of <cite id="3">4 members</cite>.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors with <cite id="2">verified zakat eligibility</cite> serving critical humanitarian needs in regions like Palestine, Yemen, and Syria.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Baitulmaal due to its <cite id="1">99/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could expand its board size beyond the current 4 members.

impact.explanation: Operations show an exceptional <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite> and highly efficient fundraising at <cite id="1">$0.10 per $1 raised</cite>.
impact.improvement: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes but developing theory of change

rich_narrative.headline: Baitulmaal, Inc. provides high-impact humanitarian aid and sustainable development to vulnerable populations globally while maintaining exceptional financial transparency.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to maximize the financial efficiency of their zakat contributions toward global humanitarian relief.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with confidence
Prioritize organizations with near-perfect program expense ratios
Care deeply about humanitarian crises in regions like Palestine and Yemen
giving_considerations: The organization has experienced recent revenue contraction
Programs operate in highly volatile regions
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations with extensive academic RCT evidence or those focused primarily on domestic US capacity building.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks basic outcome metrics and holds a Platinum Candid seal, but lacks rigorous third-party RCT evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Baitulmaal provides direct humanitarian aid and sustainable development tools to vulnerable populations.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that humanitarian interventions are actually improving lives rather than just delivering outputs.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Given the recent revenue contraction, there is significant capacity to absorb additional funding to return to previous operational scales.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an exceptional <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite> compared to the peer median of 89.8%.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief and orphan care
similar_organizations.name: Zakat Foundation of America

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief and orphan care
similar_organizations.name: Hidaya Foundation

strengths.detail: The organization dedicates a <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite> to its humanitarian initiatives.
Baitulmaal has earned a <cite id="1">99/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> alongside perfect scores in Culture and Leadership.
The charity demonstrates excellent resource management with a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="1">$0.10 per $1 raised</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Baitulmaal excels in financial accountability and efficiency. With a <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="1">$0.10 per $1 raised</cite> in fundraising efficiency, donors can be confident their contributions directly support humanitarian programs. The organization's commitment to transparency is validated by its <cite id="1">99/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Platinum Seal from Candid.
rich_narrative.summary: Baitulmaal, Inc. is a dedicated humanitarian organization providing disaster relief, orphan sponsorship, and sustainable development globally. The organization reported <cite id="3">$23,687,125 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Demonstrating exceptional financial efficiency, Baitulmaal maintains a <cite id="3">93.6% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that maximum funds reach beneficiaries. The charity is highly rated by independent evaluators, earning a <cite id="1">99/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holding a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid. Furthermore, the organization operates with high fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="1">$0.10 per $1 raised</cite>. For Muslim donors, Baitulmaal is <cite id="2">fully zakat-eligible</cite>, serving categories including fuqara, masakin, and riqab across multiple crisis zones.
